summary_about_you:
Hung Yin Chen (Kelly) is an ambitious and dedicated AI professional with a Master's degree in Artificial Intelligence from Duke University and a Bachelor's degree in Management Science, Industrial and Information Management from National Cheng Kung University. She has a strong academic background in AI, data science, and software development, backed by a robust GPA of 3.92/4. 

With technical skills in Python, LLMs, Computer Vision, AWS, Google Cloud, Git, SQL, Power BI, and Tableau, Kelly is well-equipped to handle a wide range of AI tasks. She has a proven track record of building, training, and fine-tuning machine learning models, as seen in her work experience at Hera Fertility and Earthbook. 

Her hands-on experience in AI research and machine learning engineering, coupled with her proactive approach to problem-solving, make her an ideal candidate for the AI Intern position at Armada. Kelly is a motivated team player who thrives in fast-paced environments and is always eager to stay updated with the latest AI advancements and research papers. 

She has demonstrated leadership abilities in her role as the Head of Student Outreach at the Duke AI Competition Club and as the Vice President at the NCKU Entrepreneur Association Club. Kelly is deeply passionate about AI and is driven by a constant desire to learn, innovate, and make a significant impact in the field.
why_this_role_interests_you:
This role as an AI Engineer at Armada greatly interests me because it aligns perfectly with my academic background and professional experience. I have a Master of Engineering in Artificial Intelligence from Duke University and have developed a strong foundation in AI/ML techniques, data preprocessing, and model optimization, which are key responsibilities in this role. I have also gained hands-on experience in deploying AI models into applications and integrating them across functions during my tenure as an AI Researcher at Hera Fertility and a Machine Learning Engineer Intern at Earthbook.

I am particularly excited about Armada's mission of bridging the digital divide with advanced technology infrastructure. I believe that the work I would be doing as an AI Engineer at Armada would be impactful and meaningful. I am also drawn to the opportunity to stay updated on the latest AI advancements and research papers, as I am always eager to learn and stay at the forefront of AI technologies.

Furthermore, I thrive in fast-paced environments and have a growth mindset, which I believe would make me a strong fit for the company culture at Armada. I am confident that I can bring value to your team with my strong problem-solving skills, detail-oriented approach, and ability to work both independently and collaboratively.
relevant_projects:
1. Fundus Image Prediction for Diabetic Retinopathy @ Duke Spring 2025: Built computer vision-based deep learning models for diabetic retinopathy detection, improving F1 score by 32% over classical ML models, achieving 0.8214 F1 with VGG16. Applied Explainable AI (Grad-CAM) for model interpretability, measuring Intersection over Union with the expert-labelled dataset, and built a web application for real-time diabetic retinopathy detection.

2. RAG-Based Career Guidance System @ Duke Spring 2025: Built a Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG)-based career guidance system by implementing text processing, semantic search, and retrieval pipelines, improving career insights from diverse resumes.

3. Automated Evaluation of Startup Pitches @ Duke Spring 2025: Developed an AI tool to evaluate startup pitches using GPT-4o scoring and deep learning models (BERT, Llama3.2) on ~500 YC videos. Achieved a QWK score of 0.72 by fine-tuning Llama3.2 with chain-of-thought distillation, outperforming traditional ML approaches by 48%.
technical_skills: Python, R, Java, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, Pandas, NumPy, SQL, Deep Learning, NLP, Computer Vision
career_goals: The user has a strong educational foundation in AI and Machine Learning, with a Master's degree in Engineering with a focus on Artificial Intelligence and relevant coursework. She has also gained valuable practical experience through various internships and projects, where she has developed and implemented AI and machine learning models. As an AI engineer at Armada, she aims to apply her skills and experience to assist in building, training, and fine-tuning machine learning models. She is interested in conducting research on AI trends, tools, and techniques, and working with large datasets for data preprocessing, cleaning, and feature engineering. Her goal is to stay updated on the latest AI advancements and research papers, and contribute to cutting-edge projects in artificial intelligence and machine learning to help bridge the digital divide with advanced technology infrastructure.
